Package com.nickslibrary.datastructures.linear

Class DynamicArray<T>

java.lang.Object
com.nickslibrary.datastructures.linear.DynamicArray<T>
public class DynamicArray<T> extends Object

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor
    Description
    DynamicArray()
    Constructs a dynamic array with a default initial capacity of 10.
    DynamicArray(int initialCapacity)
    Constructs a dynamic array with the specified initial capacity.
    DynamicArray(List<T> items)
    Constructs a dynamic array with the elements from the provided list.

  • Constructor Details

    • DynamicArray

      public DynamicArray()
      Constructs a dynamic array with a default initial capacity of 10.

    • DynamicArray

      public DynamicArray(int initialCapacity)
      Constructs a dynamic array with the specified initial capacity.
      Parameters:
      initialCapacity - the initial capacity of the array

    • DynamicArray

      public DynamicArray(List<T> items)
      Constructs a dynamic array with the elements from the provided list.
      Parameters:
      items - the list of items to initialize the array with

  • Method Details

    • add

      public void add(T element)
      Adds an element to the dynamic array. If the array is full, it will resize the array to accommodate the new element.
      Parameters:
      element - the element to add to the array

    • add

      public void add(List<T> items)
      Adds a list of elements to the dynamic array. Each element in the list is added individually to the dynamic array.
      Parameters:
      items - the list of elements to add to the array

    • add

      public void add(int index, T element)
      Adds an element at the specified index. If the array is full, it will resize the array to accommodate the new element.
      Parameters:
      index - the index to insert the element at
      element - the element to insert at the specified index

    • get

      public T get(int index)
      Retrieves the element at the specified index.
      Parameters:
      index - the index of the element to retrieve
      Returns:
      the element at the specified index
      Throws:
      IndexOutOfBoundsException - if the index is invalid

    • remove

      public void remove(int index)
      Removes the element at the specified index. Shifts all elements after the index to the left to fill the gap. Reduces the size by 1 and nullifies the last element to avoid memory leaks.
      Parameters:
      index - the index of the element to remove

    • resize

      public void resize()
      Resizes the internal array to accommodate more elements. The capacity is doubled every time resizing occurs.

    • size

      public int size()
      Returns the number of elements currently in the array.
      Returns:
      the number of elements in the array

    • capacity

      public int capacity()
      Returns the current capacity of the array.
      Returns:
      the current capacity of the array

    • toString

      public String toString()
      Converts the array to a string representation. This method is useful for printing the array content.
      Overrides:
      toString in class Object
      Returns:
      a string representation of the array

    • shrinkToFit

      public void shrinkToFit()
      Reduces the capacity to match the current size.

    • clear

      public void clear()
      Removes all elements from the array.
